title: Structured Argumentation Instruction Design in Virtual Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in fundamental science curriculum knowledge and practical experience
context.additional_context: A course designed to help elementary school teachers effectively guide argumentation activities in science classes, emphasizing asynchronous collaborative environments using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can analyze argument structures related to scientific phenomena and present clear claims and evidence.
Learners can verify the validity of argumentation processes through peer assessment and feedback in virtual forums.
Learners can apply a structured argumentation template (CLAIM-EVIDENCE-REASONING) in PBL projects to design scientific problem-solving solutions.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
